ratings.rComments: Last comment was by Carty. You're not fooling anybody. Moving on, I thought the class was hard, but I did learn a fair amount. The only issue is that I had to work ridiculously hard for it. If you aren't afraid of the work, it's a good class. But if you're looking to learn a lot with the minimum amount of work, look elsewhere.

Prof Carty is now with us in Florida and I am SO Grateful to have him as my teacher! Awesome Class and so much wisdom! Our whole class is signing up with him for next semester for 0028! Awesome job Boss man! Thanks for proving Illinois wrong! Looking forward to next semester! You arent hard to approach either! Recommend all to sign up with him!

Lectures are hard to follow, does alot of explaining on how to derive formulas rather than working explaining example problems. Rarely uses book, Exams are the worst, feel like they are the impossible questions to give on an exam. He might try to be funny at times but it doesnt make up for the actual learning material of the course. AVOID
He tries to be funny, but he is a pretty big jerk. He likes to pick favorites out of the class. His exams are extremely hard. Try to avoid if possible.

Okay, So this guy is nice. But his exam is TOO DAMN HARD!!! He doesn't go over the textbook. He just teach you in his own way, and give you some hw in the book. Even if you got 5 on AP CAL BC, dont take his class.

This class is difficult. Taking notes is extremely important, especially since he doesn't usually go by the textbook and sometimes just tells you the textbook is wrong. don't write down derivations of equations, just the final equation/theorem and when to use it. Lectures are useful and some tests are works of the devil.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! Find another professor. You may think it is not a big deal when you sign up, but after you fail the first and second test, you will regret every second. This class is impossible for anyone who plans on eating, sleeping and doing any other homework.

Incredibly tough. The lectures are incredibly helpful and he is really clear when lecturing. That said, his tests required a serious amount of studying, but at the end of it all, I learned more in that class than any other class. I would also like to point out that Carty is actually a pretty cool guy, but he intimidates like everyone.
Ridiculously tough exams, but I learned more in his math class than any other that I've ever taken.

This is one of the most difficult classes I've ever taken. That said, it is one of the classes I've learned the most in. I would suggest going to discussion and using worksheets to study for exams. If you know the worksheets in and out, you will be able to do well on the exams.
This is an extrememly difficult class.  If youre in the class the only way to do well is to go to discussion and hope someone there can teach it to you

The hardest class I have ever taken, hands-down. Ignores most of what the book teaches yet assigns homework from it. Spends all lecture working on broad proofs rather than actual examples. Favors engineers and mathematicians over all else. Exams will make you want to put your head down and cry in your seat.

The first couple of weeks will be awkward and rough as you get used to his style (Hint: many people have called him "The Ogre" before, and they weren't exactly wrong) After a while, it gets easier, but you really have to take good notes and use them to understand ANYTHING on the homework/exams.

Carty is a great professor. Some people may not like his attitude, but if you see past that, you'll realize that he cares about his students and the class. It's a tough course, there's a lot of work involved, but if you stay on track and keep up with the lecture (ie read notes before lecture, go to office hours, etc) you'll be fine.

It's good that Calc 3 isn't all that difficult, because if it was, Carty wouldn't help you much. He knows his stuff, but the way he teaches is just not very clear to some. He has a lot of filler material within the main material, which just bores the hell out of you. His test difficulty depends on which section you're in.
real tough
His homework has nothing to do with the exams... be prepared...

If you're one of those people who don't read the book, he's your perfect professor for you.  Everything you need to know are in his lecture notes. His method of teaching may confuse you but it all makes sense at the end of the semester.  But watch out, he's a good test writer, so study all the material well.

My favorite teacher in college so far. I loved his dynamic teaching style and down-to-earthness. I also liked that he taught mainly to the smarter kids. Instead of lowering the bar for everyone he keeps it high. Great great teacher.

Regret ever taking this proffesor, he was supposed to teach well, but he is just plain horrible at it, ignores the book completely yet uses it for homework. If your an engineer, stay away, he focuses on the mathematical side of things, like proofs and spends very little time on the important stuff that you will need later on.
Calc 3 in general is a difficult class, Carty was good because he writes everything so taking notes is as simple as following along. He makes his notes colorful and often checks for clarity.

Calc 1... My first college math course and I have Carty.  I get a 49% on my first exam.  Class average of 30 something.  He is a tough test writer, but he is very clear in what he expects you to know and if you don't know it forwards and backwards you can easily fail.  I took calc 3 with him too and once I knew his style it was just fine.

This class is very hard. But if you study you should do fine. Carty knows his stuff but is a bit intimidating to approach. His notes are very helpful. You actually have to attend lecture and study ALOT and do homework to get an A though.

I didn't like Carty's way of teaching initially because I *thought* he wasn't clear enough in class. I struggled with the first 2 exams and homework. After midsem, I learned that it's the effort you put in yourself that matters. I learned a whole deal of discipline and hardwork in this course. From a C+ to an A. Yay!

TC is a menace to society... everyone at the University of Illinois should take his class and know the mathematician inside TC... a professor to remember for the ages, and a name to remember for the future of mathematics.  TC's calculus and comedy blend together to form the parameterization of a perfect class...
Very helpful good notes and funny keeps students interested in class.

I originally wanted to get out when I first saw I had Carty(I had him for 220 as well) He is one of those teachers that you absolutely HATE, but later you're glad you had him because you know the material so much better than those that didn't have him. He is REALLY hard during the class, but it is so worth it!
Agree with last comment, learned much more from a floormate. Carty's a nice guy but he certainly does not make the material interesting and his notation and quick speed make it hard to follow
I've learned more from a guy on my floor than from attending his lectures.
Really good notes. Really good explanations. Really good lectures. Kind of mean though. :(

This is on tough mother. He likes to yell alot and make weird (but funny) remarks while teaching. Yeah his test are hard, but he puts an appropriate curve on the tests. The homework is extremely tough to do on your own, so what I did was go to the Illini Hall tutoring and got help there. Just man through the class. Its tough but you do learn

His Calc 3 class is tough.  He covers a lot of things analytically and with rigor.  If you are a math major or engineer, his course will make following classes easier. He gives a good base in upper level math and I thought he was a good lecturer.  It does require a lot of work though, so you are warned.

This is a professor who really cares about what you do and learn out of class. he puts the course material in a simplest form it could possibly take and allows lots of time for students to fully understand. MY ASS
comes off as a jerk. moves fast. homework is very difficult and posted a day or two before due date.

Carty tries to make up for lack of teaching by obnoxiously swearing in hopes that the class will think he's "cool." He's definitely not. Go to tutor hours for your homework, and you should get a C/B if you're lucky. Some exams are curved more heavily than others.

This class is too hard for a 100-level course, especially when most of the students in the class because it is required for their major. Carty complicates the material with excessive writing and definitions. That being said, lectures are optional, but if you miss a few, you'll be lost. Make sure you go into tutor hours for your homework.

Everyone gives him a hard time (well not to his face), but he's a really good professor. He actually cares about the Math, which is something you can't say for all professors. And if you pay attention during lecture, and write down EXACTLY what he says, you'll do fine. He goes through his notes really fast, but when I go back and read through them,

Everyone gives him a hard time (well not to his face), but he's a really good professor. He actually cares about the Math, which is something you can't say for all professors. And if you pay attention during lecture, and write down EXACTLY what he says, you'll do fine. He goes through his notes really fast, but when I go back and read through them,
We should really be more sympathetic with him, after all, it must be hard for him to deal with menopause....actually scratch that, every old woman has to go through why should he be a special case?

Carty is great. YES, the class is hard and YES, you have to work-WELCOME TO COLLEGE! He doesn't hand out the answers-class is about theory and concepts and application. Like he said, the class is for the people who have the passion and dedication to work so that they can use this stuff in the future.  Slackers and cry babies, beware!
did a great job
Hes pretty funny, explains things pretty well. his tests are kinda hard but not impossible.  overall not bad

This class is hard enough where you need a professor that explains the material well.  His first exam had a class average of around 36 percent and his second exam dindt change by a lot. I would never take another class with him again.

Very difficult but makes it very clear what to expect from him. He tells all the students the first day of class how hard it has been in the past for other students. Go to class, take notes, and do the assigned homework and you will be fine. Easy B, impossible A. Lots of babes in this class too.

I wouldn't be surprised if he's not at U of I next year.  I know two people who's grade he changed on a test from a D to an A-, just on the basis that he liked them.  This is not legal, teachers at a university can't do this.  I will do my best to bring this to the attention to the head of the department so he can be removed as a teacher at a of i.
He's not as nad as most of these whiners say.  very clear. understandable

Has a strange personality.  He isn't very helpful when you ask him.  Thinks he's funny and tries too hard.  His teaching methods are absolutely bogus and he makes the class much harder than it should be.  Don't recommend his 125 class unless you must take it.
He is a fat **** ****, but one hell of a teacher.
hes really not that bad.  just do good on the first two tests, and decent on the third, and you should be set.  He curves your final grade anyways.

The other posts are ridiculous.  If you put in a little effort and go to the ta's to get help on the homework once every week or 2, you should do just fine.  Don't listen to the other posts, they all need to learn how to put in some effort.  The beginning of the class is very easy, but gets harder at the end.  Keep up with work and you will do fine

This was supposed to be an easy class but turned out to be the opposite. Carty does not deserve to be at the university and because his class is that awful the university is changing the business requirement. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE!!
His tests aren't that bad, but the graded homework (turned in once every week and a half to 2 weeks) if hard as hell. I don't mind the profanity, but he doe s go awfully quick.

This man goes way to fast for his students and for himself. He thinks if he throws in a swear every now and then it makes up for his lack of teaching ability.  He is the biggest joke of this university and should not be allowed to go near a classroom.  He does not even know what he is teaching half the time.  You must be able to write 50 #s per sec

This class is not that horrible. He isn't very clear on things, and many times he even said that he has no idea what things mean, it is just how it is done, but if you go home and reread, it is easier to understand. You can't always learn everything in class, this is college.

Superfluous use of profanity does NOT make Carty cool.  He flies through lessons very quickly without ever explaining concepts thoroughly.  Trying to get hold of a ta who can help before a test is almost impossible. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS.
This guy is pretty funny. His tests are kind of difficult and he does go semi-fast. As long as you go to lecture, you will do fine.
He goes way too fast, and does not cover stuff more than once. If you don't get it the first time, you're screwed over.
Yeah okay swearing a lot automatically makes you funny, Mr. Carty. You know what would be really funny? If you could lecture correctly.
